# MSStickerView

**Class**

A view for displaying a sticker.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class MSStickerView
```

## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSStickerView] class to display stickers. The sticker view also provides drag-and-drop functionality. The user can press and hold a sticker to peel it from the view, and then drag the sticker to any balloon in the transcript.

## Working with Sticker Views

- **init(frame:sticker:)**: Initializes a new sticker view with the provided sticker and frame.
- **sticker**: The displayed sticker object.

## Controlling Sticker Animation

- **animationDuration**: The amount of time it takes to complete the sticker’s animation.
- **isAnimating()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the sticker is animating.
- **startAnimating()**: Starts the sticker’s animation, beginning with the first frame.
- **stopAnimating()**: Stops the sticker’s animation.

## Custom sticker packs

- **Adding Sticker packs and iMessage apps to the system Stickers app, Messages camera, and FaceTime**: Enable your Sticker pack or iMessage app in the media context.
- **Adding your sticker packs to Messages**: Drag and drop your sticker pack into the Stickers asset catalog to let people access your stickers from Messages.
- **MSStickerBrowserViewController**: A view controller that provides dynamic content to the standard sticker browser.
- **MSStickerBrowserView**: A browser view that displays a dynamically generated list of stickers.
- **MSStickerSize**: The size of the stickers in the browser view.

## Inherits From

- UIView

## Conforms To

- CALayerDelegate
- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
